question: Which country's national football team is nicknamed as "Los Chapines", "La Bicolor" and "La Furia Azul"?
explanation: Guatemala's national football team is nicknamed as "Los Chapines", "La Bicolor" and "La Furia Azul". The Guatemala national football team represents Guatemala in men's international football and is controlled by the Federacion Nacional de Futbol de Guatemala. Founded in 1919, it has been affiliated to FIFA since 1946, and it is a member of CONCACAF. The team has made three Olympic tournament appearances, competing at 1968, 1976, and 1988 Olympic Games. Guatemala has never qualified for the finals tournament of the World Cup, although they have reached the final round of qualification on four occasions.
